item.title: Bitcoin Ponzi Schemer Hints at Dealings With Mt Gox CEO - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bitcoin Ponzi Schemer Hints at Dealings With Mt Gox CEO - CoinDesk

Convicted Ponzi scheme operator Trendon Shavers is now insinuating the major unidentified debtor cited in his defense against the SEC was Mark Karpeles, CEO of the now-defunct bitcoin exchange Mt Gox.

item.title: Why Ethereum Classic Must Die - CoinDesk
item.description:
Why Ethereum Classic Must Die - CoinDesk

Jacob Eliosoff is a computer programmer and former Wall Street quant who runs Calibrated Markets LLC, a cryptocurrency investment firm with holdings in BTC and ETH. In this opinion piece, Eliosoff discusses why he believes the ethereum community needs to unite around one implementation of the protocol, and why he believes it should be the version that opted for a controversial fork.

item.title: Security questions dog Bitcoin over hacks
item.description:
Security questions dog Bitcoin over hacks

By , @bayareanewsgroup.com Posted: 08/19/2016 06:11:58 PM PDT Updated: 08/19/2016 06:11:58 PM PDT It seemed bitcoin exchange Bitfinex was doing all the right things. In the end, that didn't stop hackers from stealing $65 million. The latest in a long list of attacks on the digital currency since its birth in 2009 has been particularly vexing for the bitcoin community.

item.title: In the Bitcoin Era, Ransomware Attacks Surge
item.description:
In the Bitcoin Era, Ransomware Attacks Surge

One evening in April, Dave Winston stood in a convenience store in suburban Charlotte, N.C., uneasily shoving $20 bills into a slim automated-teller machine unlike any he had ever seen. He was buying bitcoin, a digital currency unknown to him a few hours earlier, before hackers took over his computer.

item.title: Overstock's New Blockchain President to Accelerate 'Fight Against Wall Street' - CoinDesk
item.description:
Overstock's New Blockchain President to Accelerate 'Fight Against Wall Street' - CoinDesk

After 14 years working with Overstock.com, the e-commerce giant's chairman of the board was asked to leave the room during a board meeting last month. For Jonathan Johnson, who had previously served in leadership roles, including a stint as Overstock's CEO, it was an unusual moment.

item.title: Ethereum Prediction Market Service Takes First Steps With Beta Launch - CoinDesk
item.description:
Ethereum Prediction Market Service Takes First Steps With Beta Launch - CoinDesk

A new prediction market platform is set to go live on the ethereum network this week. Called Gnosis, the project will allow users to wager on future events by asking and answering questions about the outcome of sports games or elections.

item.title: Gartner: Blockchain Tech Hits Hype Cycle Peak - CoinDesk
item.description:
Gartner: Blockchain Tech Hits Hype Cycle Peak - CoinDesk

Blockchain has hit the peak of its hype cycle according to Gartner. That's the key finding from a new report, issued this week, that asserts the emerging technology is at a stage in its development where users and the public are suffering from "inflated expectations" about its benefits.

item.title: Bitfinex: Cause of Bitcoin Hack Still 'Unknown' - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bitfinex: Cause of Bitcoin Hack Still 'Unknown' - CoinDesk

Nearly two weeks after losing more than $60m in customer funds, Bitfinex reports it has not yet identified how the theft was carried out. In a statement released earlier today, the exchange reported it had hired Ledger Labs, a blockchain consultancy previously contracted by ShapeShift following its own cybersecurity problems, to both investigate the theft as well as perform a balance sheet audit.

item.title: To Go Big on Blockchain, 'Big Four' Firm PwC Thinking Small - CoinDesk
item.description:
To Go Big on Blockchain, 'Big Four' Firm PwC Thinking Small - CoinDesk

To scale up its blockchain work, 'Big Four' audit firm PwC is thinking small with its strategy. PwC FinTech director Geraldine Balaj yesterday revealed fresh details about her firm's plans at Blockchain Conference New York.

item.title: Bitcoin.org Warns of Attacks Amid Upcoming Bitcoin Software Release - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bitcoin.org Warns of Attacks Amid Upcoming Bitcoin Software Release - CoinDesk

A new post on the open-source Bitcoin.org website indicates its contributors have reason to believe the online resource may be targeted by malicious actors following an upcoming software release by Bitcoin Core developers. Bitcoin.org contributor Cobra-Bitcoin published a post today in which he indicated that certain resources the website intends to post following the Bitcoin Core development update could be the target of unspecified "state-sponsored attackers".
